title: D-Wave’s cross-platform quantum computing services are a bridge to the future
content:
While I’m convinced 2011 will ultimately go down in history as the year the groundbreaking motion picture “Cowboys & Aliens” was released, it bears mentioning that it was also the year in which the first commercial quantum computer officially went online. You can dispute whether Daniel Craig’s turn as an alien-fighting gold thief with amnesia is worthy of such high praise, but there’s no debating that D-Wave’s a bonafide pioneer in the world of quantum computing. Dubbed the “D-Wave One” (two years before the Xbox One gaming system came out), the company’s first production model was a quantum annealing system…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: Optimization? Simulation? Quantum annealing? Gate-based computers? It's obvious the future of quantum is cross-platform. 😎
